subtasks: Identify the appropriate time for pruning (late March/early spring)
Gather necessary tools (pruners, lopper, Swedish saw)
Open up the tree canopy to reduce disease potential
Remove tall, vertically growing branches to prevent future height issues
Prune out branches growing into the canopy to prevent rubbing and wounds
Maintain proper pruning technique (cut just above the branch collar)
Thin out inner branches to improve air circulation
Avoid excessive pruning (no more than 25% of branches per year)

tasks.task: Pruning an apple tree in late March/early spring
subtasks: Choose the appropriate time for pruning (late March/early spring)
Assemble necessary tools: pruners, lopper, Swedish saw
Open the tree canopy to reduce disease potential and improve airflow
Remove tall, vertically growing branches to prevent future ladder use
Prune branches growing into the canopy to avoid rubbing and wounds
Make cuts just above the branch collar to promote healing
Thin out interior branches to enhance air circulation
Limit pruning to no more than 25% of branches per year to minimize shock to the tree
